newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: SOCCER-MOLDOVAN SPURS GRASSHOPPER TO 3-1 WIN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-MOLDOVAN SPURS GRASSHOPPER TO 3-1 WIN.

text.p: Viorel Moldovan hit two first-half goals to propel Grasshopper to a 3-1 win over Auxerre in their European Champions' League group A match on Wednesday.
The victory avenged a 1-0 loss to the French champions two weeks ago and virtually guarantees Grasshopper a place in the quarter-finals.
The Swiss league's leading scorer with 14 goals, Moldovan's two strikes were his first in the Champions' League.

He put Grasshopper ahead in the 17th minute when he hammered home from point blank range past goalkeeper Lionel Charbonnier, who was left sprawling after making a diving save from Murat Yakin's header.
Grasshopper increased their lead when Kubilay Turkylimaz was brought down by Alain Goma and Moldovan scored from the spot in the 29th minute.
Auxerre cut the deficit when Grasshopper's Mats Gren scored an own goal just two minutes into the second half.
However, Grasshopper captain Gren atoned 12 minutes later when he rocketed a 20-metre shot past Charbonnier.
